name: Honey-Garlic Shrimp and Pineapple Skewers
author: Bren
summary: Nothing says summer like shrimp on the grill. This quick recipe will have dinner on the table in under 30 minutes. Serve over rice, pasta, or a salad.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons low-sodium soy sauce (such as Bragg®)
4 ounces large shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 each bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 20 minutes
directions: Combine butter, honey, lemon juice, pineapple juice, garlic, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes in a small saucepan over medium-low heat
Simmer until sauce begins to thicken, 3 to 4 minutes
Set aside 1/2 of the sauce for dipping
Thread pineapple, shrimp, and bell pepper alternately onto both skewers and baste with the remaining sauce
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat (400 degrees F (200 degrees C)) and lightly oil the grate
Grill until shrimp are cooked through and opaque in color, turning halfway, 5 to 7 minutes
